src:
"Ni la façana de l'edifici on visc és un 'pipican' ni la vorera un 'cacacan'"
04 Nov 2019, 10:59 by Teresa Coll
Sóc una veina del carrer de Lluís Sagnier, al districte d’Horta Guinardó, i voldria denunciar l’actitud incívica i poc respectuosa d’alguns propietaris de gossos del nostre barri que no recullen els excrements dels seus animals. En el meu cas concret puc asegurar que utilitzen la façana de l’edifici on visc com un ‘pipican’ i la vorera com un ‘cacacan’.
Ja fa molt de temps que això passa, però darrerament s’ha incrementat la presència d’excrements a les voreres, on queda demostrat el poc civisme d’algunes persones, perque al gossos no se’ls pot culpar de res.
Ja sé que la resposta de l'ajuntament serà que la normativa obliga els propietaris d'animals a recollir les seves necessitats del carrer però, què passa quan aquests no ho fan? Què passa quan els propietaris de gossos no compleixen les mínimes normes de civisme? Com que sé que és un problema de difícil solució, voldria demanar-li a l’Ajuntament de Barcelona que revisi i augmenti el servei de neteja amb aigua per les voreres de la zona, aquest servei és gairebé inexistent. Molts ciutadans els hi agrairem.
Sóc de poble. Allí els gossos no van lligats i les voreres estan impecables, al menys de caques de gos.

"Neither the facade of the building where I live is a 'pipican' nor the side a 'cacacan'"
04 Nov 2019, 10:59 by Teresa Coll
I am a neighbor of Carrer de Lluís Sagnier, in the district of Horta Guinardó, and I would like to denounce the unhealthy and unfriendly attitude of some owners of dogs in our neighborhood that do not collect the excrement of their animals. In my case I can assure you that they use the facade of the building where I live as a 'pipican' and the sidewalk as a 'cacatone'.
It has been a long time since this is happening, but lately there has been an increase in the presence of stool on the sidewalks, where the little civility of some people is shown, because the dogs can not be blamed for anything.
I already know that the city council's response will be that the regulations force pet owners to collect their needs from the street, but what happens when they do not? What happens when the dog owners do not meet the minimum standards of civility? Since I know that it is a problem of difficult solution, I would like to ask the City Council of Barcelona to review and increase the water cleaning service on the sidewalks of the area, this service is almost non-existent. Many citizens will appreciate it.
I am a town. There the dogs are not tied and the sidewalks are impeccable, at least with dog falls.
